forecast.name: Overnight
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly cloudy, with a low around 50. West southwest wind around 9 mph.

forecast.name: Saturday
forecast.shortForecast: Patchy Fog then Chance Light Rain
forecast.detailedForecast: Patchy fog between 8am and 9am, then a chance of rain. Partly sunny. High near 58, with temperatures falling to around 55 in the afternoon. West southwest wind 8 to 18 mph, with gusts as high as 25 mph. Chance of precipitation is 40%.

weather_report:
San Francisco awakens this morning, draped in a delicate veil of cloud cover, reminiscent of the city’s ever-charming mystique. Expectation stirs in the coastal air, hinting at the typical patchy fog that dances with the sunlight, but less of a thick marine shroud. As the hours roll forward, the fog may lift slightly by morning, but it will likely yield to the possibility of rain, filtering the day from brilliance into a softer palette. The high will hover around a cool 58, giving way to a tranquil yet brisk afternoon, encouraging layers to ward off the chill that whispers through the west-southwest winds.

Embrace this nuanced day by dressing wisely—perhaps a light jacket paired with a cozy scarf to counter the flirtation of cooler breezes. Strolling along the Embarcadero could prove enchanting, the promise of moisture in the air mixing beautifully with the vibrant urban tapestry that is ever-present. Alternatively, you may find a tucked-away café inviting, perfect for sipping a warm brew while watching the world unfurl outside your window. Today is not merely about the conditions, but about donning comfort and reveling in the rhythm of a city that breathes alongside its intricate climate.
